result.execSummary:
The defendant Garth Leonard Groshek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.  After 3 months may be eligible for electronic monitor, if found eligible according to jail rules - stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

May tranfer to Milwaukee County.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs. 
Valid prescription and take according to the prescription. 
Submit DNA sample.
Court grants expungment under 973.015, if successfully completes probation and if Agent recommends.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Garth Leonard Groshek

records.addlTxt:
9:21 a.m. Defendant Garth Leonard Groshek in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Requested with held sentence - Probation w/conditions
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: Count 1: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 2 is dismissed and read in.

ADA Cousins states joint agreement.  
Atty Barkely concurs with recommendation. 

BY THE COURT:****PROBATION***
I/S Sentence: 6 months Jail, after 3 months may be eligible for electronic monitor, if found eligible according to jail rules - stayed
12 months probation, may be tranfer to Milwaukee County
Conditions:
50 hours community service
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs. 
Valid prescription and take according to the prescription. 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.  
Court grants expungment under 973.015, if successfully completes probation and if Agent recommends.
Pay costs + DNA surcharge.
***Submit DNA sample.***

ADDRESS INFO for Garth Leonard Groshek
Current: 3340 N Oakland Ave, Shorewood, WI 53211 United States  (Effective: 05-11-2016)
Prior: 2970 Sky View Rd, Amherst Junction, WI 54407
Plea hearing on May 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Garth Leonard Groshek in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:08 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Matter is set for an arraignment.

Address of Defendant is verified.

Atty Barkley received a copy of information, waives reading and enters pleas of NOT GUILTY.
Defense has gone over maximum penalties. 

Court accepts pleas.

Matter will be pretrialed this morning and minutes will then be filed with the Court.

Defendant Garth Leonard Groshek not in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Cousins indicates Atty Barkley filed a written waiver.  Asks the matter be scheduled for arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
to Appear and Act - Atty Barkley

Defendant Garth Leonard Groshek in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

2:08 p.m. Defendant Garth Leonard Groshek in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant says he has Atty Barkley.
Court continues the initial appearance.  Initial appearance scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Alexander Wardall
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Clerk is Shelley P.
10:32 a.m.  ADA Cass Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video with Attorney Erik McFarland.

ADA Cass Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Manufacture/Deliver THC, Possess Drug Paraphernalia and Resisting or Obstructing an Officer.
Atty McFarland does not wish to make any statements.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a signature bond of $2,500.00 with conditions as stated.
Atty McFarland has no objection to this bond request.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: November 16, 2015 @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3.
